title: Platinum Equity buys Anuvu to boost airline connectivity
key_assets: ['in-flight connectivity technology', 'software-defined satellites', 'Astranis micro-GEO satellites (2 in service, options for up to 8)', 'modem technology', 'market share in in-flight entertainment (50%) and cruise line entertainment (80%)', 'capacity deal with Telesat', 'content and technology capabilities for adjacent markets']
summary: Platinum Equity, a Los Angeles-based private equity firm, announced plans to acquire Anuvu, a provider of in-flight connectivity and media services for aviation and maritime markets. The deal is expected to close before year-end. Anuvu, which emerged from bankruptcy in 2021, has refocused its strategy around software-defined satellites and recently activated its first two Astranis micro-GEO satellites. The acquisition aims to capitalize on growth opportunities in airline and cruise connectivity, as well as expand into adjacent markets like media processing and advertising.
why_it_matters: This acquisition highlights the growing investment in satellite-based connectivity solutions for aviation and maritime industries. Anuvu's shift toward software-defined satellites and its partnership with Astranis reflect broader industry trends toward flexible, reprogrammable satellite capacity. The deal also underscores the recovery and strategic refocusing of companies impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic, as well as the increasing competition and innovation in in-flight connectivity.
